commit_message:
remove _append_null_domain_id decorator

This decorator is only useful when upgrade Keystone form Liberty
to higher release. I don't think any deployments will upgrade
from Liberty to Queens directly. And Liberty is eol already. So
it's safe engouth to remove it.

Change-Id: I891b0d3e87e8c011a2db758fc84dbd4590f78c96
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/48/527848/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def _append_null_domain_id(f): """Append a domain_id field to a role dict if it is not already there. When caching is turned on, upgrading from liberty to mitaka or master causes tokens to fail to be issued for the time-to-live of the cache. This is because as part of the token issuance the token's role is looked up, and the cached version of the role immediately after upgrade does not have a domain_id field, even though that column was successfully added to the role database. This decorator artificially adds a null domain_id value to the role reference so that the cached value acts like the updated schema. Note: This decorator must appear before the @MEMOIZE decorator because it operates on the cached value returned by the MEMOIZE function. """ @functools.wraps(f) def wrapper(self, *args, **kwargs): ref = f(self, *args, **kwargs) if 'domain_id' not in ref: ref['domain_id'] = None return ref return wrapper @_append_null_domain_id

Client functions for Routes

Adds CRUD operations for the v3/Routes.

blueprint bp/role-check-from-middleware

commit_message:
Fix APIException if cinder is not installed

If cinder is not installed, Sahara API validation will return
an APIException with error message "Cinder is not supported".
Test case "test_node_group_templates" throw an exception:
  "saharaclient.api.base.APIException: Cinder is not supported"

Change-Id: Ic54eea43b9de9373320550d2e54cdaa415e1a603

commit_message:
Run shade functional tests on ansible OpenStack PRs

When someone makes a PR to the OpenStack modules in Ansible, we want to
run shade's functional tests. Turn this on.

Depends-On: I93459ffc116f9106d9eb8000a7e5a58bea507308
Change-Id: Ib9350b6a531da1e8effd096e0157c14e4d3a7555

commit_message:
Migrate object_store to resource2/proxy2

This is the last thing we need to migrate before deleting the old
resource/proxy class.

There's a good pile of things related to uploading and downloading we
should port over from the openstack.cloud code. One of them, streaming
the object data, was added here. We can come back around and get all of
the large-object upload code supported.

Adds alias support into _BaseComponent much like prop used to have
because Swift needs it.

Port some of the unittests to requests-mock because it was just easier
to do that. Doing so uncovered some issues with case-sensitivity and
headers. As a result, there are some changes to resource2.Resource to
get case sensitivity sorted out. TODO comments have been left indicating
a few places for further cleanup, but those are internal and
non-essential.

The default value of has_body is changed to False for head calls.
Because. Well. Let's be honest. It's HEAD. There is no body. By
definition.

Change-Id: I8c4f18f78a77149e23b98f78af82b1d25ab7c4cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/23/533323/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack import proxy2 as proxy return self._list(_container.Container, paginated=True, **query) container = self._get_container_name(container=container) for obj in self._list( _obj.Object, container=container, paginated=True, **query): obj.container = container def _get_container_name(self, obj=None, container=None): if obj is not None: obj = self._get_resource(_obj.Object, download_object(self, obj, container=None, **attrs): container_name = self._get_container_name(container=container) obj = self._get_resource( _obj.Object, obj, container=container_name, **attrs) added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Managing policies in the Cluster service. For a full guide see https://developer.openstack.org/sdks/python/openstacksdk/user/guides/cluster.html """ FAKE_NAME = 'test_receiver' CLUSTER_ID = "ae63a10b-4a90-452c-aef1-113a0b255ee3" def list_receivers(conn): print("List Receivers:") for receiver in conn.cluster.receivers(): print(receiver.to_dict()) for receiver in conn.cluster.receivers(sort='name:asc'): print(receiver.to_dict()) def create_receiver(conn): print("Create Receiver:") # Build the receiver attributes and create the recever. spec = { "action": "CLUSTER_SCALE_OUT", "cluster_id": CLUSTER_ID, "name": FAKE_NAME, "params": { "count": "1" }, "type": "webhook" } receiver = conn.cluster.create_receiver(**spec) print(receiver.to_dict()) def get_receiver(conn): print("Get Receiver:") receiver = conn.cluster.get_receiver(FAKE_NAME) print(receiver.to_dict()) def find_receiver(conn): print("Find Receiver:") receiver = conn.cluster.find_receiver(FAKE_NAME) print(receiver.to_dict()) def update_receiver(conn): print("Update Receiver:") spec = { "name": "test_receiver2", "params": { "count": "2" } } receiver = conn.cluster.update_receiver(FAKE_NAME, **spec) print(receiver.to_dict()) def delete_receiver(conn): print("Delete Receiver:") conn.cluster.delete_receiver(FAKE_NAME) print("Receiver deleted.")

commit_message:
Fixes deprecated neutron config option usage

The neutron nova_metadata_ip config option had its name
deprecated replaced with nova_metadata_host. Because of this,
a few unit tests are failing. This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I6915e4b3c362cf01fc8377bcfc8f09f00aae0e24

commit_message:
Add tags to plays

Adds various tags to the deploy_steps_playbook output.

- facts: Run fact gathering
- overcloud: Run all plays for overcloud deployment
- pre_deploy_steps: Run deployments that happen pre deploy_steps
- host_prep_steps: Run host_prep_tasks
- deploy_steps: Run deploy_steps
- post_deploy_steps: Run deployments that happen post deploy_steps
- external: Run all external deployments
- external_deploy_steps: Run all external deployments

external and external_deploy_steps are the same for now. However, I kept
them both b/c "external" is the parallel for "overcloud", and
"external_deploy_steps" is the parallel for "deploy_steps".

Also fixes the name of the host_prep_tasks play that was incorrectly
named "Deployment steps".

Change-Id: Ic6579d187035d00edc1f9190f8ebd12d4400d919
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/66/518566/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add new metrics for Cadvisor plugin

improvements for monasca self-monitoring
add metrics:
- number of cores
- memory used (percentage)
- file system used (percentage)

story: 2001407
task: 6099

Change-Id: I11dd367543b6c17b9935aa4826345dd5df721445
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/87/528687/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.cadvisor_machine_url = None self.total_mem = 0 self.num_cores = 0 def _parse_machine_info(self, machine_info): topo_info = machine_info['topology'] # Grab first set of info from return data topo_info = topo_info[0] #store info about total machine memory if topo_info['memory']: self.total_mem = topo_info['memory'] self.log.debug("host memory = {}".format(self.total_mem)) else: self.log.warn("Failed to retrieve host memory size") #store information about # of cores (incl. threads) if machine_info['num_cores']: self.num_cores = int(machine_info['num_cores']) self.log.debug("number of cores of machine: {}".format(self.num_cores)) self.log.warn("number of cores of machine: {}".format(self.num_cores)) else: self.log.warn("Failed to retrieve number of cores of host") if not self.cadvisor_machine_url: # retrieve machine info only once split_str=self.cadvisor_url.split("/api") if len(split_str) > 0: self.cadvisor_machine_url = "{}/{}".format(split_str[0], "api/v2.0/machine") try: machine_info = requests.get(self.cadvisor_machine_url).json() except Exception as ex: self.log.error("Error communicating with cAdvisor to collect machine data - {}".format(ex)) else: self._parse_machine_info(machine_info) else: self.log.error("Cannot determine machine url to retrieve host info") if cadvisor_key == "usage": used_mem = int(memory_data[cadvisor_key]) # calculate memory used percent if self.total_mem > 0: used_mem_perc = (float(used_mem)/float(self.total_mem))*100 # send metric percent used self._send_metrics("mem.used_perc", used_mem_perc, dimensions, metric_types, metric_units) else: self.log.warn("no value for total host memory, memory usage (percent) couldn't be calculated") if cadvisor_key == "usage": usage_fs = int(filesystem[cadvisor_key]) elif cadvisor_key == "capacity": capacity_fs = int(filesystem[cadvisor_key]) if capacity_fs > 0: self._send_metrics("fs.usage_perc", (float(usage_fs)/capacity_fs)*100, file_dimensions, ["gauge"], ["percent"]) else: self.log.warn("no value for file system capacity, file system usage (percent) couldn't be calculated") #provide metrics for number of cores self._send_metrics("cpu.num_cores", self.num_cores, dimensions, ["gauge"], ["number_of_cores"])

commit_message:
Designate - Neutron integration

This patchset implements Designate - Neutron integration feature
based on Neutron extension drivers. As a result DNS records can be
automatically created in Designate when Neutron ports or floating
IPs are created.

Closes-Bug: #1704769
Depends-On: I13b2ab39bd1daac13112398762f2be06022594b0
Change-Id: I001507eff6a3342cc77188e0f4087fa4fcc67b95

commit_message:
Make sure we use config defaults in profile compat code

The compat code to allow creating a Connection from a Profile has a
couple of bugs. First of all it doesn't return the config object it
creates. (whoops) Second, it doesn't build its config kwargs from a base
of the config defaults, so some code in CloudRegion breaks. The second
bug would also exist in from_session, although we haven't seen it in the
field yet.

Change-Id: Ibd0056e6484cfa9a4c8be6a8bc40a0eb2df76977

commit_message:
Add upgrade to OSC

This change adds database support for the python-openstackclient
project for the upgrade and cluster-upgrade commands.

The trove command upgrade is now:
    openstack database instance upgrade
The trove command cluster-upgrade is now:
    openstack database cluster upgrade

Change-Id: Ic416d476c645fa3c697881fb001d512ed3d25d2b
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Do not assume all protocols in neutron-lib are usable for SG

Tempest is branchless and thus supposed to work against older
deployments.  Also, it's supposed to work against other
implementations, which might not support the same set as
the reference implementation.  Ideally SG can have a way
to discover the set of usable protocols.  But for now,
let's make this conservative a bit.  It might still be too
aggressive because the set of protocols here was taken from
Ocata. (neutron-lib 1.1.0)

Closes-Bug: #1742385
Change-Id: Id67037252aafbacbe43f6af786f30a687321952d

like what we used to do.

commit_message:
update constraint for os_vif to new release 1.9.0

- This change blacklists os-vif 1.8.0 as it breaks
  compatiblity with kuryr-kubernetes
  (Ie1b65fb29b6abcf77a531404e67c7e60b2183c19)
  and introduces a file handel leak  due to an
  upstream bug in pyroute2
  (https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/pull/443).

Depends-On: Id05ed5dced8ca26800585b98d65c0a12570773e2

commit_message:
Update jobs for ansible-role-cloud-launcher

use the new ansible jobs for this repo - like all other ansible repos
do. move from trusty to xenial for testing as well.

This repo was the last repo using the templates, so let's move forward
here.

commit_message:
Clarify developer docs for contributors

The current documentation for setting up a development environment
currently omits needing many of the basic build tools for each
linux distribution, which for a new install will cause failures when
walking through the steps for setting up a development environment.

This change adds some commands for installing the various build
libraries needed for running tox and installing dependencies.

Change-Id: I072beb9dee35603f207b71908b0bdcd3a48a5208
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/18/531518/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: In addition to running `bindep`, you may need to install some essential build libraries if your environment does not have them already. The command to install these libraries differs based on the distribution being used: Ubuntu .. code-block:: bash $ apt install build-essential RDO .. code-block:: bash $ yum/dnf install make automake gcc gcc-c++ kernel-devel SUSE .. code-block:: bash $ zypper install -t pattern devel_basis

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-05 01:07:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/7b204cea635ea4f7c740b0031ac48b573a9f97ed', 'message': 'WIP Skip unnecessary image uploads

This modifies the container image upload to avoid doing an upload when
the destination image already exists and is identical to the source
image.

This is done by doing a skopeo inspect on the source and destination
images and compares their digest hash.

The eventual aim is to make noop uploads fast enough to justify doing
them every time in the main deploy workflow.

Marked as WIP while metrics are collected on how much time is saved.

Change-Id: Ic9422b0ca168b4405cb1973f4e33c91b0f69f02c
Closes-Bug: #1738668
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-17 03:15:36.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/image/test_image_uploader.py', 'tripleo_common/image/image_uploader.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/18a1349a772b0a3f7dfceb06570c9da1f875ca72', 'message': "Skip unnecessary image uploads

This modifies the container image upload to avoid doing an upload when
the destination image already exists and is identical to the source
image.

This is done by doing a skopeo inspect on the source and destination
images and compares their digest hash.

In RDO Cloud, a full upload takes around 8 minutes. With this change
and an already populated local registry it takes less than 10 seconds.
The extra 2 skopeo inspect calls per upload doesn't measurably impact
the full upload time.

This makes the upload fast enough to run within the main deploy
workflow on every run (which will take more work because the upload
yaml file needs to be stored in the plan).

Change-Id: Ic9422b0ca168b4405cb1973f4e33c91b0f69f02c
Closes-Bug: #1738668
"}]
commit_message:
Skip unnecessary image uploads

This modifies the container image upload to avoid doing an upload when
the destination image already exists and is identical to the source
image.

This is done by doing a skopeo inspect on the source and destination
images and compares their digest hash.

In RDO Cloud, a full upload takes around 8 minutes. With this change
and an already populated local registry it takes less than 10 seconds.
The extra 2 skopeo inspect calls per upload doesn't measurably impact
the full upload time.

This makes the upload fast enough to run within the main deploy
workflow on every run (which will take more work because the upload
yaml file needs to be stored in the plan).

Change-Id: Ic9422b0ca168b4405cb1973f4e33c91b0f69f02c
Closes-Bug: #1738668

commit_message:
Fix _port_arg for security rules with icmp/ipv6-icmp aliases

When a security group rule is created with icmp/ipv6-icmp alias such as
protocol number 1(ICMP), 58(ICMPv6) or string icmpv6(legacy name for
ipv6-icmp) as its protocol along with ICMP/ICMPv6 message type
specified, _port_arg will generate a wrong str for iptables/ip6tables.

Change-Id: Iae01b9a0da34797a5f061a110f06e18be9bbec5a
Closes-Bug: #1743552

commit_message:
libvirt: create vGPU for instance

If an allocation is asking for a VGPU, then libvirt will look at the
available mediated devices and call the sysfs to create one of them if
needed.

Please note I commented in the relnote all the caveats we currently have
with mediated devices in libvirt, but I'll provide some workarounds for
those in the next changes.

Change-Id: Ibf210dd27972fed2651d6c9bd73a0bcf352c8bab
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-support-for-vgpu

added_lines: class LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevMDEV(LibvirtConfigGuestHostdev): def __init__(self, **kwargs): super(LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevMDEV, self).__init__( mode='subsystem', type='mdev', model='vfio-pci', managed='no', **kwargs) self.uuid = None def format_dom(self): dev = super(LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevMDEV, self).format_dom() address = etree.Element("address", uuid=self.uuid) source = etree.Element("source") source.append(address) dev.append(source) return dev def parse_dom(self, xmldoc): childs = super(LibvirtConfigGuestHostdevMDEV, self).parse_dom(xmldoc) for c in childs: if c.tag == "source": for sub in c.getchildren(): if sub.tag == 'address': self.uuid = sub.get('uuid')

added_lines: import functools def list_logical_volumes(select_criteria=None, path_mode=False): ''' List logical volumes :param select_criteria: str: Limit list to those volumes matching this criteria (see 'lvs -S help' for more details) :param path_mode: bool: return logical volume name in 'vg/lv' format, this format is required for some commands like lvextend :returns: [str]: List of logical volumes ''' lv_diplay_attr = 'lv_name' if path_mode: # Parsing output logic relies on the column order lv_diplay_attr = 'vg_name,' + lv_diplay_attr cmd = ['lvs', '--options', lv_diplay_attr, '--noheadings'] if select_criteria: cmd.extend(['--select', select_criteria]) lvs = [] for lv in check_output(cmd).decode('UTF-8').splitlines(): if not lv: continue if path_mode: lvs.append('/'.join(lv.strip().split())) else: lvs.append(lv.strip()) return lvs list_thin_logical_volume_pools = functools.partial( list_logical_volumes, select_criteria='lv_attr =~ ^t') list_thin_logical_volumes = functools.partial( list_logical_volumes, select_criteria='lv_attr =~ ^V') def extend_logical_volume_by_device(lv_name, block_device): ''' Extends the size of logical volume lv_name by the amount of free space on physical volume block_device. :param lv_name: str: name of logical volume to be extended (vg/lv format) :param block_device: str: name of block_device to be allocated to lv_name ''' cmd = ['lvextend', lv_name, block_device] check_call(cmd)

Invert validation task order

We should check that the Horizon endpoint is
configured correctly before running the validation.

commit_message:
Add label to namespaces

This patch set adds label to "kube-system" and "default"
namespaces used for podSelector.

Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Make config-download workflow's verbosity configurable

This exposes the 'verbosity' option from the ansible mistral action,
which will allow us to view more verbose outputs from the ansible
playbook's run.

Change-Id: If7207428561e9f64950d9e2ac438b94d6556fe0d

commit_message:
Add ability to list all system role assignments

This commit makes it so users can query the /role_assignments API
with ?scope.system=all.

bp system-scope

added_lines: elif group_id: else: assignments = self.list_all_system_grants() for assignment in assignments: a = {} if assignment['type'] == self._GROUP_SYSTEM: a['group_id'] = assignment['actor_id'] elif assignment['type'] == self._USER_SYSTEM: a['user_id'] = assignment['actor_id'] a['role_id'] = assignment['role_id'] a['system'] = {'all': True} system_assignments.append(a) def list_all_system_grants(self): """Return a list of all system grants.""" actor_id = None target_id = self._SYSTEM_SCOPE_TOKEN assignment_type = None return self.driver.list_system_grants( actor_id, target_id, assignment_type )

Make entries in policy_mapping.rst consistent

Some entries in the list were prepended with dashes while others were
not. This commit makes all of them consistent.

commit_message:
Sync charm-helpers

Notable issues resolved:

openstack_upgrade_available() broken for swift
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-swift-proxy/+bug/1743847

haproxy context doesn't consider bindings
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1735421

regression in haproxy check
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1743287

Change-Id: Ia04dc04d29bed66077e6765b0a327dab56a3b0ea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-cinder refs/changes/43/535743/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import json WARNING, is_ipv6, ) from charmhelpers.contrib.network.ip import ( get_iface_for_address, get_netmask_for_address, ) from charmhelpers.contrib.hahelpers.cluster import ( get_hacluster_config ) JSON_ENCODE_OPTIONS = dict( sort_keys=True, allow_nan=False, indent=None, separators=(',', ':'), """ Configure DNS-HA resources based on provided configuration and update resource dictionaries for the HA relation. _relation_data = {'resources': {}, 'resource_params': {}} update_hacluster_dns_ha(charm_name(), _relation_data, crm_ocf) resources.update(_relation_data['resources']) resource_params.update(_relation_data['resource_params']) relation_set(relation_id=relation_id, groups=_relation_data['groups']) def assert_charm_supports_dns_ha(): """Validate prerequisites for DNS HA The MAAS client is only available on Xenial or greater :raises DNSHAException: if release is < 16.04 """ if lsb_release().get('DISTRIB_RELEASE') < '16.04': msg = ('DNS HA is only supported on 16.04 and greater ' 'versions of Ubuntu.') status_set('blocked', msg) raise DNSHAException(msg) return True def expect_ha(): """ Determine if the unit expects to be in HA Check for VIP or dns-ha settings which indicate the unit should expect to be related to hacluster. @returns boolean """ return config('vip') or config('dns-ha') def generate_ha_relation_data(service): """ Generate relation data for ha relation Based on configuration options and unit interfaces, generate a json encoded dict of relation data items for the hacluster relation, providing configuration for DNS HA or VIP's + haproxy clone sets. @returns dict: json encoded data for use with relation_set """ _haproxy_res = 'res_{}_haproxy'.format(service) _relation_data = { 'resources': { _haproxy_res: 'lsb:haproxy', }, 'resource_params': { _haproxy_res: 'op monitor interval="5s"' }, 'init_services': { _haproxy_res: 'haproxy' }, 'clones': { 'cl_{}_haproxy'.format(service): _haproxy_res }, } if config('dns-ha'): update_hacluster_dns_ha(service, _relation_data) else: update_hacluster_vip(service, _relation_data) return { 'json_{}'.format(k): json.dumps(v, **JSON_ENCODE_OPTIONS) for k, v in _relation_data.items() if v } def update_hacluster_dns_ha(service, relation_data, crm_ocf='ocf:maas:dns'): """ Configure DNS-HA resources based on provided configuration @param service: Name of the service being configured @param relation_data: Pointer to dictionary of relation data. @param crm_ocf: Corosync Open Cluster Framework resource agent to use for DNS HA """ hostname_key = 'res_{}_{}_hostname'.format(service, endpoint_type) relation_data['resources'][hostname_key] = crm_ocf relation_data['resource_params'][hostname_key] = ( 'params fqdn="{}" ip_address="{}"' .format(hostname, resolve_address(endpoint_type=endpoint_type, override=False))) relation_data['groups'] = { 'grp_{}_hostnames'.format(service): ' '.join(hostname_group) }def update_hacluster_vip(service, relation_data): """ Configure VIP resources based on provided configuration @param service: Name of the service being configured @param relation_data: Pointer to dictionary of relation data. cluster_config = get_hacluster_config() vip_group = [] for vip in cluster_config['vip'].split(): if is_ipv6(vip): res_neutron_vip = 'ocf:heartbeat:IPv6addr' vip_params = 'ipv6addr' else: res_neutron_vip = 'ocf:heartbeat:IPaddr2' vip_params = 'ip' iface = (get_iface_for_address(vip) or config('vip_iface')) netmask = (get_netmask_for_address(vip) or config('vip_cidr')) if iface is not None: vip_key = 'res_{}_{}_vip'.format(service, iface) if vip_key in vip_group: if vip not in relation_data['resource_params'][vip_key]: vip_key = '{}_{}'.format(vip_key, vip_params) else: log("Resource '%s' (vip='%s') already exists in " "vip group - skipping" % (vip_key, vip), WARNING) continue relation_data['resources'][vip_key] = res_neutron_vip relation_data['resource_params'][vip_key] = ( 'params {ip}="{vip}" cidr_netmask="{netmask}" ' 'nic="{iface}"'.format(ip=vip_params, vip=vip, iface=iface, netmask=netmask) ) vip_group.append(vip_key) if len(vip_group) >= 1: relation_data['groups'] = { 'grp_{}_vips'.format(service): ' '.join(vip_group) }
deleted_lines: """ Check for os-*-hostname settings and update resource dictionaries for the HA relation. hostname_key = 'res_{}_{}_hostname'.format(charm_name(), endpoint_type) resources[hostname_key] = crm_ocf resource_params[hostname_key] = ( 'params fqdn="{}" ip_address="{}" ' ''.format(hostname, resolve_address(endpoint_type=endpoint_type, override=False))) relation_set(relation_id=relation_id, groups={ 'grp_{}_hostnames'.format(charm_name()): ' '.join(hostname_group)})def assert_charm_supports_dns_ha(): """Validate prerequisites for DNS HA The MAAS client is only available on Xenial or greater if lsb_release().get('DISTRIB_RELEASE') < '16.04': msg = ('DNS HA is only supported on 16.04 and greater ' 'versions of Ubuntu.') status_set('blocked', msg) raise DNSHAException(msg) return True def expect_ha(): """ Determine if the unit expects to be in HA Check for VIP or dns-ha settings which indicate the unit should expect to be related to hacluster. @returns boolean """ return config('vip') or config('dns-ha')

commit_message:
[envs] Remove credentials base

rally.deployment.credential.Credential class was a temporary workaround
to support multi-platfrom in Rally. It had not be anounced and a better
solution was found (spoiler: rally.env.platform.Platform [1][2]).

While CredentialBuilder was already removed (see [3]), Credential base
left for OpenStack support and some compatibility stuff.

Backward compatible logic can be reworked (and it is what this patch do)
in such way so we can remove th whole rally.deployment module without
breaking anyone.

[1] - Ide95c8b1e8e72293c009f4cd5e430e64eb1dd604
[2] - I83369e899a8b8609a8cd1e77b895d3a1ef8ae3e4
[3] - If7bde619f7c2e99248a071ff18b8084553e1bec0

Change-Id: I98d5c2e0113672b9f280d30f5550413a13f032ee

commit_message:
Partial revert "Revert "Remove diskimages section from nodepool-launchers""

Add back in tox.ini changes to test all versions of nodepool.yaml files.

This reverts partially commit 7c4da0c8b8bc6d3cfb10c77511cbb57cf13a7a0e.

Also, test nodepool master branch instead of deleted feature/zuulv3
branch.

Change-Id: I0b04d251f62efc362a80a7c6fb595e76c4bf3d76

commit_message:
Sync charm-helpers

Notable issues resolved:

openstack_upgrade_available() broken for swift
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-swift-proxy/+bug/1743847

haproxy context doesn't consider bindings
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1735421

regression in haproxy check
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1743287

Change-Id: Icae43be0dd03bde4df2615b5bfcb5edc44c82be2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-mon refs/changes/39/535739/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import json WARNING, is_ipv6, ) from charmhelpers.contrib.network.ip import ( get_iface_for_address, get_netmask_for_address, ) from charmhelpers.contrib.hahelpers.cluster import ( get_hacluster_config ) JSON_ENCODE_OPTIONS = dict( sort_keys=True, allow_nan=False, indent=None, separators=(',', ':'), """ Configure DNS-HA resources based on provided configuration and update resource dictionaries for the HA relation. _relation_data = {'resources': {}, 'resource_params': {}} update_hacluster_dns_ha(charm_name(), _relation_data, crm_ocf) resources.update(_relation_data['resources']) resource_params.update(_relation_data['resource_params']) relation_set(relation_id=relation_id, groups=_relation_data['groups']) def assert_charm_supports_dns_ha(): """Validate prerequisites for DNS HA The MAAS client is only available on Xenial or greater :raises DNSHAException: if release is < 16.04 """ if lsb_release().get('DISTRIB_RELEASE') < '16.04': msg = ('DNS HA is only supported on 16.04 and greater ' 'versions of Ubuntu.') status_set('blocked', msg) raise DNSHAException(msg) return True def expect_ha(): """ Determine if the unit expects to be in HA Check for VIP or dns-ha settings which indicate the unit should expect to be related to hacluster. @returns boolean """ return config('vip') or config('dns-ha') def generate_ha_relation_data(service): """ Generate relation data for ha relation Based on configuration options and unit interfaces, generate a json encoded dict of relation data items for the hacluster relation, providing configuration for DNS HA or VIP's + haproxy clone sets. @returns dict: json encoded data for use with relation_set """ _haproxy_res = 'res_{}_haproxy'.format(service) _relation_data = { 'resources': { _haproxy_res: 'lsb:haproxy', }, 'resource_params': { _haproxy_res: 'op monitor interval="5s"' }, 'init_services': { _haproxy_res: 'haproxy' }, 'clones': { 'cl_{}_haproxy'.format(service): _haproxy_res }, } if config('dns-ha'): update_hacluster_dns_ha(service, _relation_data) else: update_hacluster_vip(service, _relation_data) return { 'json_{}'.format(k): json.dumps(v, **JSON_ENCODE_OPTIONS) for k, v in _relation_data.items() if v } def update_hacluster_dns_ha(service, relation_data, crm_ocf='ocf:maas:dns'): """ Configure DNS-HA resources based on provided configuration @param service: Name of the service being configured @param relation_data: Pointer to dictionary of relation data. @param crm_ocf: Corosync Open Cluster Framework resource agent to use for DNS HA """ hostname_key = 'res_{}_{}_hostname'.format(service, endpoint_type) relation_data['resources'][hostname_key] = crm_ocf relation_data['resource_params'][hostname_key] = ( 'params fqdn="{}" ip_address="{}"' .format(hostname, resolve_address(endpoint_type=endpoint_type, override=False))) relation_data['groups'] = { 'grp_{}_hostnames'.format(service): ' '.join(hostname_group) }def update_hacluster_vip(service, relation_data): """ Configure VIP resources based on provided configuration @param service: Name of the service being configured @param relation_data: Pointer to dictionary of relation data. cluster_config = get_hacluster_config() vip_group = [] for vip in cluster_config['vip'].split(): if is_ipv6(vip): res_neutron_vip = 'ocf:heartbeat:IPv6addr' vip_params = 'ipv6addr' else: res_neutron_vip = 'ocf:heartbeat:IPaddr2' vip_params = 'ip' iface = (get_iface_for_address(vip) or config('vip_iface')) netmask = (get_netmask_for_address(vip) or config('vip_cidr')) if iface is not None: vip_key = 'res_{}_{}_vip'.format(service, iface) if vip_key in vip_group: if vip not in relation_data['resource_params'][vip_key]: vip_key = '{}_{}'.format(vip_key, vip_params) else: log("Resource '%s' (vip='%s') already exists in " "vip group - skipping" % (vip_key, vip), WARNING) continue relation_data['resources'][vip_key] = res_neutron_vip relation_data['resource_params'][vip_key] = ( 'params {ip}="{vip}" cidr_netmask="{netmask}" ' 'nic="{iface}"'.format(ip=vip_params, vip=vip, iface=iface, netmask=netmask) ) vip_group.append(vip_key) if len(vip_group) >= 1: relation_data['groups'] = { 'grp_{}_vips'.format(service): ' '.join(vip_group) }
deleted_lines: """ Check for os-*-hostname settings and update resource dictionaries for the HA relation. hostname_key = 'res_{}_{}_hostname'.format(charm_name(), endpoint_type) resources[hostname_key] = crm_ocf resource_params[hostname_key] = ( 'params fqdn="{}" ip_address="{}" ' ''.format(hostname, resolve_address(endpoint_type=endpoint_type, override=False))) relation_set(relation_id=relation_id, groups={ 'grp_{}_hostnames'.format(charm_name()): ' '.join(hostname_group)})def assert_charm_supports_dns_ha(): """Validate prerequisites for DNS HA The MAAS client is only available on Xenial or greater if lsb_release().get('DISTRIB_RELEASE') < '16.04': msg = ('DNS HA is only supported on 16.04 and greater ' 'versions of Ubuntu.') status_set('blocked', msg) raise DNSHAException(msg) return True def expect_ha(): """ Determine if the unit expects to be in HA Check for VIP or dns-ha settings which indicate the unit should expect to be related to hacluster. @returns boolean """ return config('vip') or config('dns-ha')

NOTE(thedac) For some reason the ADDRESS_MAP uses 'int' rather # than 'internal' if addr_type == 'internal': _addr_map_type = INTERNAL else: _addr_map_type = addr_type # Network spaces aware laddr = get_relation_ip(ADDRESS_MAP[_addr_map_type]['binding'], config(cfg_opt)) # commit_message:
tests: test-galera-upgrades.sh: Drop Ansible verbosity

The upgrade tests are very noisy since Ansible verbosity is set too
high. This makes debugging problems very painful so drop verbosity
by default and let users set it if desired.

Change-Id: I44b7f13f762807946ad9fdf0078e24c4c52b9da1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server refs/changes/08/535408/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_utils import uuidutils from tempest.lib import decorators from tempest.lib import exceptions as lib_exc from neutron_tempest_plugin.api import base class LoggingNegativeTestJSON(base.BaseAdminNetworkTest): required_extensions = ['logging'] @decorators.attr(type='negative') @decorators.idempotent_id('5fc61e24-cad5-4d86-a2d4-f40c0fa0a54c') def test_create_log_with_invalid_resource_type(self): log_args = {'name': 'test-log', 'description': 'test log desc', 'resource_type': 'fake_resource'} self.assertRaises(lib_exc.BadRequest, self.admin_client.create_log, **log_args) @decorators.attr(type='negative') @decorators.idempotent_id('7ed63170-0748-44b7-b0a0-64bfd9390dac') def test_create_log_with_nonexistent_port(self): log_args = {'name': 'test-log', 'description': 'test log desc', 'resource_type': 'security_group', 'target_id': uuidutils.generate_uuid()} self.assertRaises(lib_exc.NotFound, self.admin_client.create_log, **log_args) @decorators.attr(type='negative') @decorators.idempotent_id('89194c6b-8f47-400b-979b-072b1c1f767b') def test_create_log_with_nonexistent_sg(self): log_args = {'name': 'test-log', 'description': 'test log desc', 'resource_type': 'security_group', 'resource_id': uuidutils.generate_uuid()} self.assertRaises(lib_exc.NotFound, self.admin_client.create_log, **log_args)

Change default Session from Cookies to LocMem

Change-Id: I745d6a97293f0def84130c118b1f0249165fe0d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/66/444266/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - The default SESSION_ENGINE setting has been changed from signed cookies to cache. As with cookies, cached sessions should NOT be used with local memory cache in production; read more at https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/topics/http/sessions/#using-cached-sessions and https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/topics/cache/#local-memory-caching

commit_message:
Fix bugs caused by dependencies update

* Replace es2015 babel preset with env preset
* Fix ModalPanel transition
* Simplify redux-logger configuration
* remove deprecated 'ecmaFeatures' property from .eslintrc

commit_message:
agent extensions: remove 'static_routes' special casing

With this change, services produce attachment information
as raw as possible. In particular, a service can produce
multiple attachments.

This changes how so-called 'static routes' are handled,
instead of adding a new 'static_routes' key in attachment
information, a service will produce one attachment for
each static route.

This also allows to fix bug 1744241: the 'linuxif' key
provided to bagpipe-bgp when unplugging for an IPVPN with
linuxbridge was wrong. This fix is not in a separate change,
being hard to address without this change.

Closes-Bug: 1744241
Change-Id: I621494372ff91fbb7b8f811134fcb1dafdb915e8

commit_message:
tasks: lxc_apparmor.yml: Allow dnsmasq to access the AIO log directory

Since Id16b1bcd67bf075a8677206a205ece010e7b014c the Neutron services are
being deployed on baremetal instead of containers. As such, the neutron
logs are now being collected in /openstac/log/$invhostname-neutron/ so
we need to explicitly allow this directory in the dnsmasq apparmor
profile to resolve the following problem:

type=AVC msg=audit(1516203616.761:603129): apparmor="DENIED"
operation="open" profile="/usr/sbin/dnsmasq"
name="/openstack/log/controller00-neutron/neutron-dnsmasq.log" pid=17765
comm="dnsmasq" requested_mask="ac" denied_mask="ac" fsuid=0 ouid=0

Depends-On: Ibe1149ee4fedd2b3d487887e504c500c96165467
Change-Id: I543f69891b2be8bb146f9d3c3b8e0c82811d0e8a

commit_message:
tasks: Manage dnsmasq apparmor profile on supported distros

The Ubuntu apparmor-profiles package may be installed as a dependency
of another package and in that case it will create problems on Neutron
due to the dnsmasq profile. As such, it's best to manage it in a similar
fashion to the SUSE one.

Depends-On: Ibe1149ee4fedd2b3d487887e504c500c96165467
Change-Id: I13b4dcca70f930955e1156cb10817d75a922ae46

commit_message:
Add DB object version counting

Read the spec or the bp for more details.

Change-Id: I456f2a04bb6a158e25e2f577942ac91bee653298
Implements: blueprint ha-db-object-version-counter
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/47/429947/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================================== Preventing multi-table race conditions in Cinder DB =================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/ha-db-object-version-counter Right now most of potential races in Cinder DB layer was fixed thanks to `conditional updates`_. Yet there are still small number of operations that are vulnerable to race conditions (those that perform multi-table updates). This spec proposes an additional mechanism on top of conditional updates to protect multi-table updates. Problem description =================== Thanks to usage of conditional updates most of DB operations are atomic, what's left are operations that affect multiple tables during single session. There still exist window of opportunity between read and update in which concurrent update could have changed state of processed table row. Use Cases ========= Operators would want to avoid unexpected behavior in their clouds and potential data corruption in the storage back-end, as these situations are more likely to happen in an Active/Active configuration that is now supported by Cinder to handle a higher volume workload. Proposed change =============== For every DB operation that need to query and update two tables in one session, utilize version counting mechanism into SQLAlchemy. Every table affected will need version id column, which is a single table column that increments its value each time an UPDATE to the table occurs. This value is checked each time the ORM emits an UPDATE or DELETE against the row to ensure that the value held in memory matches the database value. If it doesn't match, exception is raised and whole operation needs to be repeated. Alternatives ------------ * SELECT ... FOR UPDATE, with retries on deadlocks - could serve as temporary solution, however `performance is worse`_ in comparison to currently used conditional updates. * Drop support for PostgreSQL and SQLite as discussed on `mailing list`_ - with no need to support engines other than MySQL compatible, conditional updates could be performed on multiple tables at once. Data model impact ----------------- New field storing version counter in every table affected. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ Minimal, as it only adds additional condition and / or field change to most updates. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- Once changes are made to Cinder DB API, all new methods using versioned tables will need to ensure that updates increase version counter. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Szymon Wroblewski (bluex) Other contributors: Anyone is welcome to help Work Items ---------- - Add version field to tables. - Ensure methods utilizes automatic version increase mechanism with each update. - Update queries to increase version when it won't be increased automatically. - Wrap methods changing multiple tables in retry decorator. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unittests for version-counting mechanism. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== .. _`conditional updates`: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/cinder-specs/specs/mitaka/cinder-api-atomic-status-change.html .. _`performance is worse`: http://gorka.eguileor.com/cinders-api-races/ .. _`mailing list`: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-February/thread.html#111357 * https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/cinder-active-active-vol-service-issues * http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/orm/versioning.html

commit_message:
Revert "When serializing an exception return its 'repr'"

This reverts commit c1a7079c26d27a2e46cca26963d3d9aa040bdbe8.

It breaks Glance's Unit test when updating constraint in [1], For more
detials please refer to [2]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/531788
[2]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-January/126202.html

Related-Bug: #1728368

Change-Id: Idcec3997e59232f71101c772612df25ab1f48ccf

commit_message:
Refactor quota modules

Split and encapsulate quota and quota_utils modules for better readability.

quota_driver option no longer requires full path to module
for default drivers. To keep it backward compatible, if option is set to
cinder.quota.DriverName it's changed to cinder.quota.driver.DriverName
during QuotaEngine._driver property lazy loading.

Change-Id: Icc9bf6c8b6932f50f5c87012b8eed404b50e8157

commit_message:
[WIP] Quota context manager

To avoid situations where quota rollback is not issued
and generally make code cleaner, this patch proposes
quota reservation context manager.

Change-Id: I3932e38a38ea82989b671198bf50a006814d5569
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/67/412767/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from collections import deque, defaultdict from contextlib import contextmanagerfrom oslo_utils import excutils _QUOTAS_MAPPING = { 'volume': (QUOTAS, { 'volumes': '{amount}', 'volumes_{ob.volume_type.name}': '{amount}', 'gigabytes': '{ob.size}', 'gigabytes_{ob.volume_type.name}': '{ob.size}' }), 'snapshot': (QUOTAS, { 'snapshots': '{amount}', 'snapshots_{ob.volume_type.name}': '{amount}', 'gigabytes': '{ob.size}' if CONF.no_snapshot_gb_quota else None, 'gigabytes_{ob.volume_type.name}': '{ob.size}' if CONF.no_snapshot_gb_quota else None, }), 'backup': (QUOTAS, { 'backups': '{amount}', 'backup_gigabytes': '{ob.size}', }), } @contextmanager def reserve(context, quota_engine, deltas, expire=None, project_id=None, commit=True, reraise=True): reservations = None try: reservations = quota_engine.reserve(context, expire, project_id, **deltas) except exception.OverQuota as e: if reraise: exc = quota_utils.OVER_QUOTA_RESOURCE_EXCEPTIONS res = (set(deltas.keys()) & set(exc.keys())).pop() quota_utils.process_reserve_over_quota(context, e, res, amount) raise else: commit = False try: yield reservations if commit: quota_engine.commit(context, reservations) except Exception: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): if commit: quota_engine.rollback(context, reservations) def reserve_vol_type(context, objects=(), quota_type=None, amount=1, expire=None, project_id=None, unreserve=False, commit=True, reraise=True): if not isinstance(objects, (list, tuple)): objects = (objects,) try: if not quota_type: quota_type = objects[0].__class__.__name__.lower() quota_engine, deltas_template = _QUOTAS_MAPPING[quota_type] except (IndexError, KeyError): raise ValueError(_('Unknown quota type.')) if unreserve: amount = -amount if objects: deltas = defaultdict(int) for ob in objects: fmt = dict(amount=amount, ob=ob) for k, v in deltas_template.items(): if v: deltas[k.format(**fmt)] += int(v.format(**fmt)) else: fmt = dict(amount=amount) deltas = {k.format(**fmt): int(v.format(**fmt)) for k, v in deltas_template.items() if v} return reserve(context, quota_engine, deltas, expire, project_id, commit, reraise)

commit_message:
fix barbican integration

Added auth_url to the context we pass to castellan
library. In a change [1] intended to deprecate the use
of auth_endpoint passed as the oslo config, it actually
completely removed the use of it[2], so this change became
necessary or the integration is broken.

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/483457
[2] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/483457/6/castellan/key_manager/barbican_key_manager.py@143

Change-Id: I933367fa46aa0a3dc9aedf078b1be715bfa8c054

commit_message:
Remove leading and trailing spaces from parameters

Snapshots and backup (create/update) APIs stores 'name' and
description' parameters with leading and trailing spaces in
database after patches [1][2] are merged.

This patch removes leading and trailing whitespaces before
validation and also before storing it in db for 'name' and
'description' parameters.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/520991/
[2]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530098/

Closes-Bug: #1742907
Change-Id: Ib5c8d32e2c20cbacebd7b6f7281a44f94a70f7c0

added_lines: import copyfrom oslo_serialization import jsonutilsimport webob self.user_context = context.RequestContext( fake.USER_ID, fake.PROJECT_ID, auth_token=True) @ddt.data({"backup": {"description": " sample description", "name": " test name"}}, {"backup": {"description": "sample description ", "name": "test "}}, {"backup": {"description": " sample description ", "name": " test "}}) def test_backup_update_name_description_with_leading_trailing_spaces( self, body): backup = test_utils.create_backup( self.ctxt, status=fields.BackupStatus.AVAILABLE) req = self._fake_update_request(fake.BACKUP_ID) expected_body = copy.deepcopy(body) self.controller.update(req, backup.id, body=body) backup.refresh() # backup update call doesn't return 'description' in response so get # the updated backup to assert name and description req = webob.Request.blank('/v2/%s/backups/%s' % ( fake.PROJECT_ID, backup.id)) req.method = 'GET' req.headers['Content-Type'] = 'application/json' res = req.get_response(fakes.wsgi_app( fake_auth_context=self.user_context)) res_dict = jsonutils.loads(res.body) self.assertEqual(expected_body['backup']['name'].strip(), res_dict['backup']['name']) self.assertEqual(expected_body['backup']['description'].strip(), res_dict['backup']['description'])

commit_message:
Do not select inactive l3 agent in L3AgentSchedulerTestJSON

There may be some inactive l3 agents in the system, because the
system won't delete l3 agent records that ever registered,
even if they are no longer valid.

So this is to choose only active l3 agent in resource_setup,
otherwize the testcase will fail unexpectedly because we happened
to choose an inactive l3 agent.

Change-Id: Ie14cafc883c92e791ce866d548e166702bed3d0b

commit_message:
Update link address

Link to new measurements is out of date and should be updated.
Change

commit_message:
Force ansible to ignore plugins when bootstrapping

When ansible is bootstrapping an environment there can be conflicts with
the ansible plugins we use by default, especially in the case of an
upgrade. This change sets all of the plugin environment variables to
/dev/null so that ansible ignores the existance of all plugins during
the bootstrap process.

Change-Id: I3b03e4c67c589eae528ad6400023c4247a5ca6e6
Closes-Bug: #1741221
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/77/534377/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(cloudnull): When bootstrapping we don't want ansible to interact # with our plugins by default. This change will force # ansible to ignore our plugins during this process. export ANSIBLE_LIBRARY="/dev/null" export ANSIBLE_LOOKUP_PLUGINS="/dev/null" export ANSIBLE_FILTER_PLUGINS="/dev/null" export ANSIBLE_ACTION_PLUGINS="/dev/null" export ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_PLUGINS="/dev/null" export ANSIBLE_CALLBACK_WHITELIST="/dev/null" export ANSIBLE_TEST_PLUGINS="/dev/null" export ANSIBLE_VARS_PLUGINS="/dev/null"

commit_message:
Move legacy jobs to project

This patch implements first step in zuulv3 migration guide [1]:

Move jobs to networking-calico repo following naming conventions for
Zuul v3 jobs.

Note that we do not need the periodic job
legacy-periodic-tempest-dsvm-networking-calico-master, we can use the
normal job and just run it on master.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html#legacy-job-migration-details

Change-Id: I5d008a763168f8db1db1a14051f6f827b152834f
Needed-By: Iaeb11f70d053eeeae3bd6d5e99b6d3b4407a2d4b
Co-Authored-By: Tovin Seven <vinhnt@vn.fujitsu.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-calico refs/changes/14/513314/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - hosts: all name: Autoconverted job legacy-periodic-tempest-dsvm-networking-calico-master from old job periodic-tempest-dsvm-networking-calico-master tasks: - name: Ensure legacy workspace directory file: path: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' state: directory - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x cat > clonemap.yaml << EOF clonemap: - name: openstack-infra/devstack-gate dest: devstack-gate EOF /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner -m clonemap.yaml --cache-dir /opt/git \ git://git.openstack.org \ openstack-infra/devstack-gate executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x cat << 'EOF' >>"/tmp/dg-local.conf" [[local|localrc]] enable_plugin networking-calico git://git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-calico EOF executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}' - shell: cmd: | set -e set -x export PYTHONUNBUFFERED=true export DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST=1 export BRANCH_OVERRIDE=master if [ "$BRANCH_OVERRIDE" != "default" ] ; then export OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH=$BRANCH_OVERRIDE fi export PROJECTS="openstack/networking-calico $PROJECTS" # Keep localrc to be able to set some vars in pre_test_hook export KEEP_LOCALRC=1 function pre_test_hook { if [ -f $BASE/new/networking-calico/devstack/pre_test_hook.sh ] ; then . $BASE/new/networking-calico/devstack/pre_test_hook.sh fi } export -f pre_test_hook function post_test_hook { if [ -f $BASE/new/networking-calico/devstack/post_test_hook.sh ] ; then . $BASE/new/networking-calico/devstack/post_test_hook.sh fi } export -f post_test_hook export DEVSTACK_GATE_SETTINGS=/opt/stack/new/networking-calico/devstack/devstackgaterc cp devstack-gate/devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh executable: /bin/bash chdir: '{{ ansible_user_dir }}/workspace' environment: '{{ zuul | zuul_legacy_vars }}'

commit_message:
Basic tempest tests for port associations

Tempest tests for basic validation of L3 BGPVPN
port associations functionality:
- Creation of L3 BGPVPN with port association and route
  type prefix. Update of port association by removal of routes
- Creation of L3 BGPVPN with port association and route
  type prefix. Delete of port association

Related-Bug: 1743574
Change-Id: I2b168c5fc8d137e7a7940b35ae6c9e5c2e95d567
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/87/534187/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @decorators.idempotent_id('3b44b2f4-f514-4004-8623-2682bc46bb07') @utils.services('compute', 'network') def test_bgpvpn_port_association_create_and_update(self): """This test checks port association in BGPVPN. 1. Create networks A and B with their respective subnets 2. Create router and connect it to network B 3. Create L3 BGPVPN 4. Start up server 1 in network A 5. Start up server 2 in network B 6. Associate network A to a given L3 BGPVPN 7. Associate network B to a given L3 BGPVPN 8. Give a FIP to all servers 9. Configure ip forwarding on server 2 10. Configure alternative loopback address on server 2 11. Associate network A to a given L3 BGPVPN 12. Associate port of server 2 to a given L3 BGPVPN 13. Check that server 1 can ping server's 2 alternative ip 14. Update created before port association by routes removal 15. Check that server 1 cannot ping server's 2 alternative ip """ self._create_networks_and_subnets(port_security=False) self._create_l3_bgpvpn() self._create_servers([[self.networks[NET_A], IP_A_S1_1], [self.networks[NET_B], IP_B_S1_1]], port_security=False) self._create_fip_router(subnet_id=self.subnets[NET_A][0]['id']) self._create_fip_router(subnet_id=self.subnets[NET_B][0]['id']) self._associate_fip(0) self._associate_fip(1) self._setup_ip_forwarding(1) alternative_loopback_ip = '127.0.0.2' alternative_loopback_cidr = '127.0.0.2/8' self._setup_ip_address(1, alternative_loopback_cidr) self.bgpvpn_client.create_network_association( self.bgpvpn['id'], self.networks[NET_A]['id']) port_id = self.ports[self.servers[1]['id']]['id'] port_routes = [{'type': 'prefix', 'prefix': alternative_loopback_cidr}] body = self.bgpvpn_client.create_port_association(self.bgpvpn['id'], port_id=port_id, routes=port_routes) port_association = body['port_association'] self._check_l3_bgpvpn(dest_ip=alternative_loopback_ip) self.bgpvpn_client.update_port_association( self.bgpvpn['id'], port_association['id'], routes=[]) self._check_l3_bgpvpn(should_succeed=False, dest_ip=alternative_loopback_ip) @decorators.idempotent_id('9c3280b5-0b32-4562-800c-0b50d9d52bfd') @utils.services('compute', 'network') def test_bgpvpn_port_association_create_and_delete(self): """This test checks port association in BGPVPN. 1. Create networks A and B with their respective subnets 2. Create router and connect it to network B 3. Create L3 BGPVPN 4. Start up server 1 in network A 5. Start up server 2 in network B 6. Associate network A to a given L3 BGPVPN 7. Associate network B to a given L3 BGPVPN 8. Give a FIP to all servers 9. Configure ip forwarding on server 2 10. Configure alternative loopback address on server 2 11. Associate network A to a given L3 BGPVPN 12. Associate port of server 2 to a given L3 BGPVPN 13. Check that server 1 can ping server's 2 alternative ip 14. Remove created before port association 15. Check that server 1 cannot ping server's 2 alternative ip """ self._create_networks_and_subnets(port_security=False) self._create_l3_bgpvpn() self._create_servers([[self.networks[NET_A], IP_A_S1_1], [self.networks[NET_B], IP_B_S1_1]], port_security=False) self._create_fip_router(subnet_id=self.subnets[NET_A][0]['id']) self._create_fip_router(subnet_id=self.subnets[NET_B][0]['id']) self._associate_fip(0) self._associate_fip(1) self._setup_ip_forwarding(1) alternative_loopback_ip = '127.0.0.2' alternative_loopback_cidr = '127.0.0.2/8' self._setup_ip_address(1, alternative_loopback_cidr) self.bgpvpn_client.create_network_association( self.bgpvpn['id'], self.networks[NET_A]['id']) port_id = self.ports[self.servers[1]['id']]['id'] port_routes = [{'type': 'prefix', 'prefix': alternative_loopback_cidr}] body = self.bgpvpn_client.create_port_association(self.bgpvpn['id'], port_id=port_id, routes=port_routes) port_association = body['port_association'] self._check_l3_bgpvpn(dest_ip=alternative_loopback_ip) self.bgpvpn_client.delete_port_association( self.bgpvpn['id'], port_association['id']) self._check_l3_bgpvpn(should_succeed=False, dest_ip=alternative_loopback_ip)

commit_message:
routes-control: add advertise_extra_routes to router_association

This change adds the DB, service plugin and driver hooks
to implement the new advertise_extra_routes attribute of BGPVPN
router associations.

It also adds the required methods in DB, service plugin
and driver hooks, to allow updating a router_association
resource (which was not previously proposed in the base BGPVPN
API extension).

Change-Id: I58014ea8629c1c613d1bbab1285d6ff5e25aaf9a
Partially-Implements: blueprint routes-control

commit_message:
Remove message v1 support

This has been marked for deprecation for 9 months and the v1 message
REST api has been deprecated since 2014.

This also updates the message version resource to Resource2.

Change-Id: I623297060fda2c7f44c08f5842d308efb62d4247
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/22/533322/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import json import mock import testtools from openstack.message.v1 import message CLIENT = '3381af92-2b9e-11e3-b191-71861300734c' QUEUE = 'test_queue' FAKE = { 'ttl': 300, 'body': {'key': 'value'} } FAKE_HREF = { 'href': '/v1/queues/test_queue/messages/1234', 'ttl': 300, 'body': {'key': 'value'} } class TestMessage(testtools.TestCase): def test_basic(self): sot = message.Message() self.assertEqual('messages', sot.resources_key) self.assertEqual('/queues/%(queue_name)s/messages', sot.base_path) self.assertEqual('messaging', sot.service.service_type) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_create) self.assertFalse(sot.allow_retrieve) self.assertFalse(sot.allow_update) self.assertFalse(sot.allow_delete) self.assertFalse(sot.allow_list) def test_make_it(self): sot = message.Message(FAKE) self.assertEqual(FAKE['ttl'], sot.ttl) self.assertEqual(FAKE['body'], sot.body) def test_create(self): sess = mock.Mock() obj = mock.Mock() obj.json = mock.Mock(return_value={'resources': {'k': 'v'}}) sess.post = mock.Mock(return_value=obj) sot = message.Message() msg = message.Message.new(client_id=CLIENT, queue_name=QUEUE, **FAKE) sot.create_messages(sess, [msg]) url = '/queues/%s/messages' % QUEUE sess.post.assert_called_with( url, headers={'Client-ID': CLIENT}, data=mock.ANY) args, kwargs = sess.post.call_args self.assertIn("data", kwargs) self.assertDictEqual(json.loads(kwargs["data"])[0], FAKE) def test_delete(self): sess = mock.Mock() sess.delete = mock.Mock() sess.delete.return_value = mock.Mock() sot = message.Message() sot.delete_by_id( sess, message.Message.new(client_id=CLIENT, queue_name=QUEUE, **FAKE_HREF)) url = '/queues/%s/messages/1234' % QUEUE sess.delete.assert_called_with( url, headers={'Client-ID': CLIENT, 'Accept': ''})

commit_message:
Fix devstack py35 functional test for monasca-transform

monasca-agent does not yet work with py35, removing
from projects that get installed for py35 devstack
job.

commit_message:
Use source installtype for pip in images

When making images we can install pip from git rather than distro
packages if we use the source install type. This removes the need for us
to remove the system package for pip then reinstall it from source.

Change-Id: I8215410cdd152323e318f5a77cfeadb87d857bee
Depends-On: Ia5e62b9635af90d81227274a1dd8f20474cdbf73

commit_message:
Add functional test runs for glance

The Glance functional tests used to be run along with the unit tests.
They are now broken out in to their own separate run. This adds two
new jobs for the functional (py27) and functional-py35 test runs.

Change-Id: I2b9506d8cb3f4e7e7fde25b3a8add84b6f1b143b
Depends-on: I93d7216340bef70fc18fc9943da5c740ba3d4761

osc-placement: run functional tests in check and gate queues

Let's run the functional tests in both check and gate queues, now
that we have a few successful runs, e.g.:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/452122/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457532/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457533/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457534/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457535/

Note, that test runs above still rely on the fact the following
change to Devstack is merged first:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457636/

Change-Id: Id894176ff8e12736012d8787a3092697685a5f6d

commit_message:
Exclude Storage NFS network from networks hiera

for general VIP definition for keepalived and haproxy.

Recent changes [1] [2] removed hard-coded VIP definitions
for isolated networks in favor of a general definition
for VIPs for services behind an haproxy.

Because the ganesha service on the StorageNFS network currently
has to run active/passive we need to manage its VIP via
pacemaker/corosync to migrate it to the active controller
rather than just running it behind an haproxy.

So exclude this network and VIP from the generalized treatment
of VIPs intended for services that can just run behind an
haproxy.

[1] I117454afe750451ad1f2633fa0f196bb71740b8d
[2] If8d3219a0714e3db34980e884dce84912a837865
Closes-Bug: #1743863

Change-Id: I0e38aed36cad997ae3c25054a0451690e12c8b11

commit_message:
Storwize: use DLM locks

To be able to use Storwize driver with c-vol in A/A deployment,
local file lock should be replaced with distributed lock manager.

Closes-Bug: #1742616
Change-Id: Ib7b5d90b43ba6d004d81ce355db6b853911132be

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I600fa540b45e8dfddb18c36cae778fcddccff705

commit_message:
Add memory tracer argument

Given the latest concern about the memory consumption in OpenStack
services[1], it's necessary to add mechanims to trace memory
increments as possible failures. This patch adds an extra
argument(--mem-trace) in all the generated console scripts.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-February/111413.html

Change-Id: I935418e7cf63d525b43bb7c2f02fcc151652956c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/pbr refs/changes/47/433947/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import importlib import pkgutil import resourceimport typesdef custom_profile(f): def wrapper(*args, **kwargs): base = resource.getrusage(resource.RUSAGE_SELF).ru_maxrss val = f(*args, **kwargs) increment = (resource.getrusage(resource.RUSAGE_SELF).ru_maxrss) - base if increment > 0: print("%%f MB %%s.%%s" % (increment/1024, f.__module__, f.__name__)) return val return wrapper def import_submodules(package, decorator): package = importlib.import_module(package) for loader, name, is_pkg in pkgutil.walk_packages(package.__path__): if is_pkg: import_submodules(package.__name__ + '.' + name, decorator) else: decorate(package.__name__ + '.' + name, decorator) def decorate(module, decorator): _module = importlib.import_module(module) for attr in _module.__dict__: obj = getattr(_module, attr) if isinstance(obj, types.FunctionType) or isinstance(obj, types.MethodType): setattr(_module, attr, decorator(obj)) if __name__ == "__main__": if len(sys.argv) > 1 and sys.argv[1] == '--mem-trace': sys.argv.remove('--mem-trace') try: import_submodules('%(module_name)'.split('.')[0], custom_profile) except: pass

commit_message:
vars: Drop galera_percona_xtrabackup_repo_url variable

This variable was only used on Ubuntu distributions to select the
upstream Percona repository. There is not much point in having this
configurable so simply hardcode the upstream url to the repository
information and drop the variable.

Change-Id: I12088bd52ab3c392913385001fb71555e101ef56

Remove the deprecated ceilometer-collector group

ceilometer-collector service has been remove from kolla, the
ceilometer-collector group is unnecessary for inventory, this patch
to remove it.

commit_message:
Update kolla_internal_fqdn to database_address since it defined in all.yml

through the database_address has beed defined in groups_vars/all.yml, we should
better use it, this way, if we want to use external database, we just need to
redefined in all.yml

refer to https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/group_vars/all.yml#L83
Co-Authored-By: chenqiaomin <chen.qiaomin@99cloud.net>

Change-Id: Ie559301451954e16347ceaabf02f594c5c5cbe56

commit_message:
Resolve CI issues

* update prettier dependency to version which works with npm5
  [MIT] https://github.com/prettier/prettier
* remove favicons-webpack-plugin

* autofix linting errors to make tests pass
* add simple favicon using html-webpack-plugin
* remove unused .gitignore lines

Change-Id: I6b7d1116f522a6a1dd5e8455e85f4db958424e7c
Partial-Bug: 1743722
Closes-Bug: 1743898

commit_message:
Don't load nested stack in batched ResourceGroup

Previously whenever we did a batched operation on a ResourceGroup, we
loaded the nested stack into memory in the local engine in order to
determine the current capacity. Change to using the GroupInspector class to
calculate the capacity using only RPC.

Change-Id: Ie4c6791bf70df01a66e49cb8ef104e8155c90443
Partial-Bug: #1731349

added_lines: self.inspector.size.return_value = 0 self.inspector.size.return_value = 0 inspector.size.return_value = len(self.existing) rcount = resgrp._count_black_listed(self.existing)

subject: Disable Cerberus/Sticks jobs for retirement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-19 08:09:55.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/projects.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/e43f5bc428dc59014982195ba0fe2aafe6c8858b', 'message': 'Disable Cerberus/Sticks jobs for retirement

The Cerberus and Sticks projects have been unmaintained for two years.
This commit is the first step in the retirement process.

commit_message:
We actually require 'mode http'

So it turns out that without 'mode http' redirects and rewrites
will not happen, and we're relying on it for multiple things.

Switch neutron to use http-tunnel mode instead which seems to work,
we've had no errors in our setup.

See:
https://www.haproxy.org/download/1.5/doc/configuration.txt

Quoute:
" - tunnel        : only the first request and response are processed,
                      everything else is forwarded with no analysis."

Fixes: bba80acc8b78ab3a34d61b3d0b496551e5a9258e
Change-Id: I0d9abe9731fba1e4deb64932e859f991648bb1ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/70/532170/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Only run one requirements propose post job at a time
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-18 19:42:49.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/projects.yaml', 'zuul.d/jobs.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/65e561f656982e62f180393d66042ef81a5489bf', 'message': "Only run one requirements propose post job at a time

We've seen races where two requirements proposal jobs proposed the same
change but with different change-ids. Add a semaphore so that only one
job runs at a time.

Change-Id: If6c5813044518fb788df562a8d73141b8b0b40d1
Example: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534025
"}]
commit_message:
Only run one requirements propose post job at a time

We've seen races where two requirements proposal jobs proposed the same
change but with different change-ids. Add a semaphore so that only one
job runs at a time.

Change-Id: If6c5813044518fb788df562a8d73141b8b0b40d1
Example: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534025
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/62/535462/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Limit number of requirements proposal jobs. We've seen races where # two post jobs proposed the same change with different change-ids. - semaphore: name: propose-requirements max: 1 - job: name: propose-update-requirements parent: propose-updates description: | Update other projects after changes to requirements project using proposed changes. semaphore: propose-requirements timeout: 5400 vars: update_target: requirements

added_lines: def test_list_statistics_with_long_start_time(self): query_parms = '?name=' + str(self._test_name) + \ '&statistics=' + urlparse.quote('avg,sum,min,max,count') + \ '&start_time=' + "2017-01-01T00:00:00.00Z" + \ '&end_time=' + str(self._end_time_iso) + \ '&merge_metrics=true' + '&period=100000' resp, response_body = self.monasca_client.list_statistics( query_parms) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertTrue(set(['links', 'elements']) == set(response_body)) element = response_body['elements'][0] self._verify_element(element) column = element['columns'] num_statistics_method = 5 statistics = element['statistics'][0] self._verify_column_and_statistics( column, num_statistics_method, statistics, self.metric_values) @decorators.attr(type="gate")

added_lines: from monasca_log_api import conf CONF = conf.CONF if CONF.monitoring.enable: with self._logs_processing_time.time(name=None): self.process_on_post_request(req, res) else: self.process_on_post_request(req, res) def process_on_post_request(self, req, res): try: req.validate(self.SUPPORTED_CONTENT_TYPES) tenant_id = (req.project_id if req.project_id else req.cross_project_id) log = self.get_log(request=req) envelope = self.get_envelope( log=log, tenant_id=tenant_id ) if CONF.monitoring.enable: except Exception: # any validation that failed means # log is invalid and rejected if CONF.monitoring.enable: raise self._kafka_publisher.send_message(envelope) res.status = falcon.HTTP_204 res.add_link( target=str(_get_v3_link(req)), rel='current', # [RFC5005] title='V3 Logs', type_hint='application/json' ) res.append_header('DEPRECATED', 'true')
deleted_lines: with self._logs_processing_time.time(name=None): try: req.validate(self.SUPPORTED_CONTENT_TYPES) tenant_id = (req.project_id if req.project_id else req.cross_project_id) log = self.get_log(request=req) envelope = self.get_envelope( log=log, tenant_id=tenant_id ) except Exception: # any validation that failed means # log is invalid and rejected raise self._kafka_publisher.send_message(envelope) res.status = falcon.HTTP_204 res.add_link( target=str(_get_v3_link(req)), rel='current', # [RFC5005] title='V3 Logs', type_hint='application/json' ) res.append_header('DEPRECATED', 'true')

commit_message:
DNM: demo making 'required' work on /allocation_candiates

With these changes I can get candidates that are using traits.
Whether it is fully correct or not is unknown

Note that this does nothing with microversions or anything like
that, is just a quick demo hack.

Change-Id: Ia3c301a03a1dc50ebdc7595fb9e5e962d964a1f3
Related-Bug: #1743860

added_lines: from qinling.utils import constants @mock.patch('qinling.utils.openstack.keystone.get_swiftclient') def test_post_swift_size_exceed(self, mock_client): self.override_config('auth_enable', True, group='pecan') swift_conn = mock.Mock() mock_client.return_value = swift_conn swift_conn.head_object.return_value = { 'accept-ranges': 'bytes', 'content-length': str(constants.MAX_PACKAGE_SIZE + 1) } body = { 'name': 'swift_function', 'code': json.dumps( { "source": "swift", "swift": {"container": "container", "object": "object"} } ), 'runtime_id': self.runtime_id, } resp = self.app.post( '/v1/functions', params=body, expect_errors=True ) self.assertEqual(400, resp.status_int)

commit_message:
No need to define "_attrs" in Service class

The "_attrs" is an attribute of base.APIResourceWrapper rather
than that of APIDictWrapper. So there's no need to define it in
the Service class which is a subclass of APIDictWrapper

Change-Id: Id1447b9b9963d84ec987cb062c28863400d90966

added_lines: It is best to install it via pip. a compatible version of trove-dashboard. * After pip installs it, locate the trove-dashboard directory and * Reload Apache to pick up the changes to Horizon.
deleted_lines: While there packages available for Mitaka, they have a `bug <https://bugs.launchpad.net/trove-dashboard/+bug/1580527>`_ which prevents network selection while creating instances. So it is best to install via pip. a compatible version of trove-dashboard. 7.0.0.0b2 is known to work with the Mitaka release of Trove. * After pip installs them locate the trove-dashboard directory and * Reload apache to pick up the changes to Horizon.

commit_message:
Add setting for user menu links

* User menu links can be specified in the settings page
* Defaults to the standard Open RC links (bug and help links are
  not modified in this patch)
* Url, name and icon can all be specified

Change-Id: I3cbcfbf06ede18d468d4c611ad6005cb74f1b284
Closes-Bug: 1736048

master into stable/pike.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/68/534868/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if env is None: env = os.environ env = env.copy() # When running a localized python script, we need to tell it that we're # using utf-8 for stdout, otherwise it can't tell because of the pipe. env['PYTHONIOENCODING'] = 'utf8' if env is None: env = os.environ env = env.copy() # When running a localized python script, we need to tell it that we're # using utf-8 for stdout, otherwise it can't tell because of the pipe. env['PYTHONIOENCODING'] = 'utf8'

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-05 10:20:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/693ccc2f7dfe4d34a9485a1168b0322cdde61658', 'message': 'Preserve trailing slash in domain remap

The request path processed through domain remap middleware will always
skip the trailing slash of the path. In conjunction with static web,
this leads to requests like /v1/AUTH_a/c/AUTH_a/c/ because static web
will redirect the caller to an URL with the trailing slash.
This fix will readd the trailing slash, if it was present in the
original request path.
Static web will still redirect to bogus URLs if the trailing slash is
missing, but this fix ensures serving correct request path (as most
browsers will add the trailing slash per default).
In addtion with this https://review.openstack.org/#/c/390846/ the
whole chain with cname lookup, domain remap and static web is now even
working with https.

commit_message:
Preserve trailing slash in domain remap

The request path processed through domain remap middleware will always
skip the trailing slash of the path. In conjunction with static web,
this leads to requests like /v1/AUTH_a/c/AUTH_a/c/ because static web
will redirect the caller to an URL with the trailing slash.
This fix will readd the trailing slash, if it was present in the
original request path.
Static web will still redirect to bogus URLs if the trailing slash is
missing, but this fix ensures serving correct request path (as most
browsers will add the trailing slash per default).
In addtion with this https://review.openstack.org/#/c/390846/ the
whole chain with cname lookup, domain remap and static web is now even
working with https.

Change-Id: I47ff64c6cad1241abead65509f6caf174e858e0c
Partial-Bug: #1190625

commit_message:
Revert "Remove diskimages section from nodepool-launchers"

We seem to be having exceptions now:

2018-01-18 21:15:29,955 ERROR nodepool.NodePool: Exception in main loop:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/nodepool/launcher.py", line 893, in run
    while not self._stopped:
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/nodepool/launcher.py", line 758, in updateConfig
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/nodepool/launcher.py", line 721, in loadConfig
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/nodepool/config.py", line 148, in loadConfig
    p.load(newconfig)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/nodepool/driver/openstack/config.py", line 127, in load
    diskimage = config.diskimages[i.name]
KeyError: 'centos-7'

This reverts commit 7885d734e6de9ae0e69de75b7eaa2b4110808899.

Change-Id: I43e73abac15828af1c0be514dcff3d370765f2ec

commit_message:
Reinitialize the virtualenv

In the previous patch removing the virtualenv-tools, we've updated
paths to the proper binaries, but we don't reset the virtualenv
like what we used to do.

Change-Id: I5b391e06a48148f13e719d41ea1a9525a206274f
Partial-Bug: #1741634

subject: Add Cloud Shell feature
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-18 09:48:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zun-ui/commit/f0f86ed55dfbd499a0b05c11580651ad04b86f09', 'message': "[WIP] Add Cloud Shell feature

This patch realizes the Cloud Shell feature as following manner.

1. Add 'Cloud Shell' menu on the top menu bar.
2. When 'Cloud Shell' menu clicked, create console area on
   the bottom of window.
3. If cloud shell container does not exists for the user,
   create the container.
4. If cloud shell container exists, attach the console area
   to the container.
5. Each time when attach to the container, clouds.yaml will be
   exported into the container.
6. Password will be not imported into the container,
   so user should set manually 'OS_PASSWORD' into envirinment
   variables or 'password' into clouds.yaml.

To test, copy file[1] to directory[2], and restart Horizon.

[1] zun_ui/local_settings.d/_0330_cloud_shell_settings.py
[2] horizon/openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.d/
